ca.uwaterloo.epad.ui

Class Canvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • vialab.SMT.PGraphicsDelegate
      • vialab.SMT.Zone
        • ca.uwaterloo.epad.ui.Canvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener, processing.core.PConstants

    public class Canvas
extends vialab.SMT.Zone
    This class is the implementation of Canvas widget that is provides the painting functionality. It switches into movement mode when the side drawers are open, but when the drawers are closed, it captures the location of touches and renders strokes accordingly to the selected brush and paint. The Canvas also supports a colouring mode, which is similar to the colouring books.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dmitry Pyryeskin

        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of the top left corner of the canvas
        y - w-coordinate of the top left corner of the canvas
        width - width of the canvas
        height - height of the canvas
        backgroundColour - colour of the canvas

    • Method Detail

      • getDrawing

        public processing.core.PImage getDrawing(boolean hideOverlay)
        Return the current drawing.
        Parameters:
        hideOverlay - if false then the overlay image will be blended over the main image (in an overlay image is defined) and if true then the overlay image will be ignored.
        Returns:
        the current drawing with or without the overlay image (depending on the parameter)

      • setOverlayImage

        public void setOverlayImage(java.lang.String filename)
        Set the overlay image and enable the colouring mode. The areas of the specified file that are meant to be coloured in must be transparent.
        Parameters:
        filename - path to the image file to be used as overlay
